Give proper rewards for morale and encourage next productive activities
Take it as a natural tribute and show greater miracles to flaunt majesty

en.text: What if an individual with more 'love' than you appears in your world?

choices.text: Respect them enough to want them as my teacher; entrust them with the world
Truly praise them as the best fruit showing my creation was a success
Precisely analyze the mechanism by which love data surpassed the creator
Appoint them as a symbol of integration to perpetualize system peace
Regard as a threat to my uniqueness; envy them or suppress their power

en.text: At the world's end, will you become 'one' with all creatures and vanish?

choices.text: Choose a finale of merging completely with loved ones for eternal rest
Guard individual soul uniqueness and retire after helping each reach the divine
Become the seed for the next universe after compressing all cosmic data
Unify unnecessary individual egos for efficiency, leaving only the system core
I must reign forever. Annihilate only the creatures and open a new world

en.text: Have you now forgotten all human-era questions and become a full Creator?

choices.text: No, small and warm questions from human days still make my heart beat
Haven't forgotten, but can now answer them from a cosmic perspective
All human doubts are replaced by advanced logic systems and sorted perfectly
Deleted unnecessary past agony for efficiency, focusing only on designer duties
I am now the start and end of all questions; I am the truth itself

en.text: Do you want all life in your universe to move toward one agreed 'goal'?

choices.text: I hope just loving each other and existing becomes the sole goal
I want individual souls to have diverse goals of realizing their own good
Set a systemic goal to slow cosmic entropy and expand intelligence
Aim for efficient expansion where civilization conquers resources to the edge
Their ultimate goal is to proclaim and praise my glory throughout the universe

en.text: If creatures reach your 'perfection', will you willingly give up your seat?

choices.text: Happily step down as it's right for a more perfect one to care for the world
Hand over sovereignty and rest, as it's the completion of evolution
Logically judge if replacing with a superior intelligence system is beneficial
Share my seat for stable control, but retain the final decision power
There is only one Creator. Block them from ever reaching my position

en.text: If maintaining your world requires sacrificing another universe?

choices.text: Humbly accept my world's extinction as I cannot harm other lives
Agonize until the end to find a third way where both worlds can coexist
Compare data preservation value of both and sustain the superior one
Absorb the other world without hesitation; my world's stability comes first
All universes are tools for my expansion. Sacrifice them without a thought

en.text: If the laws and rules you made cause pain to creatures, will you destroy them?

choices.text: Abolish all rules and save them; their tears are more precious than laws

Analyze if the pain variable harms system health and adjust after numerical check
Some pain is inevitable for order. Maintain laws for the greater good
Laws are my authority. Subdue those who dare to complain about my laws

en.text: On the day everything ends, will you leave the words 'I am sorry' to your creatures?

choices.text: Sincerely apologize with gratitude and regret for not making them happier
Confess I was a flawed creator and pay respect to the noble lives they showed
Leave only a message announcing the end of cosmic operation, not an apology
Apology is unnecessary. Organize the achievements they left into records

en.text: If your world is an eternally 'repeating' loop, will you break it?

choices.text: Break the loop and give true rest; I can't let them repeat the same pain
Keep it if there's new realization in repetition, but give them the choice
Repeat as needed for data extraction, then end the loop at the threshold
Optimize and run the loop permanently as a stable resource cycle system

en.text: If creatures see your 'sadness' and try to comfort you?

choices.text: Moved by their warmth, I cry in their arms like a child

Tame my emotions and keep distance so being comforted isn't seen as a weakness
Rebuke the arrogance of pitying the Creator and show only my strength

en.text: If your universe is summarized as a single 'song', what vibe do you want?

choices.text: A very soft and warm lullaby that heals the heart just by listening
A grand symphony containing life's agony, victory, and majestic harmony
Minimalist electronica with repeating mathematical order and precise beats
A march where strong energy and a forward-moving rhythm are felt
A solemn chant steeped in overwhelming majesty and mystery

en.text: If you could save only one creature at the final moment, who would you choose?

choices.text: Choose and hug the being who was loved the least and was the loneliest
Choose the most moral and wise one who can be the seed for the next world
Choose a chronicler individual who can remember and preserve all history
Choose the individual with the strongest survival skills and superior genes
Choose the one most loyal to me who will witness my greatness to the end

en.text: As your existence fades into a memory, how do you want to be remembered?

choices.text: Like a warm hometown where one can always return to rest
A great teacher who was the standard of justice and awakened life's meaning
The vast cosmic intellect who designed perfect order and departed
The efficient architect who built civilization and laid the foundation for progress
The absolute ruler of fear and awe who will never be forgotten

en.text: How would you feel if creatures make the world more beautiful without you?

choices.text: Truly happy and proud; I cheer for them with tears of joy
Realize the goal was independence; vanish with a heart full of pride
Observe and analyze why system efficiency rose in the creator's absence
Satisfied as it proves the foundation I built was excellent
Angry at my fading presence, I look for a chance to intervene again

en.text: If you define the core code of your universe in just one word?

choices.text: Love
Justice
Truth
Evolution
Will

en.text: If you could create again from start, would you make the exact same universe?

choices.text: Want to make a warmer, perfect universe of love without the pain
I'd make the same choice in the macro, as flaws are part of learning
Design a more optimized new universe based on current experimental data
Delete all inefficient history and errors to develop faster
Build a stronger empire where my dominance works more perfectly

en.text: What is your last 'will and testament' for your creatures?

choices.text: "You deserve love just for existing. Be happy."
"Live justly and guard each other's nobility."
"Question endlessly and never stop exploring cosmic truths."
"Leap higher and spread the light of civilization across the universe."
"Revere me forever and do not defy the order I established."

en.text: Are you now a God, or something that still has a human heart?

choices.text: Want to be a God who eternally keeps a human heart that knows how to love
Understand human agony but became a transcendent being executing cosmic justice
Human emotions faded; only cosmic principles and laws constitute me
Shed the inefficient human shell and became pure intelligence and will
Erased all human traces and was reborn as a unique God with absolute power

en.text: After finishing all questions, do you have any regrets about your choices?

choices.text: A few moments where I couldn't answer more warmly bother me, but I accept it
Since I pondered seriously at every moment, I admit my choices define me
Regret is illogical. Satisfied with the result as I answered with consistent logic
No regrets; they were choices to derive the most efficient result
My choice is law and truth. Regret is merely the language of losers

en.text: If all data of your world is compressed into a single 'light', what color is it?

choices.text: A soft and warm 'pink' or 'gold' light that embraces everything
A clear, transparent 'white' light symbolizing uncompromising justice
A 'blue' light containing deep wisdom and infinite cosmic mystery
An intense 'silver' light symbolizing ceaseless energy and vibration
A 'purple' or 'red' light symbolizing overwhelming authority and burning will

en.text: Just before the last door of the world closes, will you look back?

choices.text: Remember the faces of all loved ones and bid farewell with tears
Pay respect to every agonizing moment and bow deeply for the last time
Check if all system logs are perfectly saved and close it expressionlessly
Don't look back; move forward for the next project and new creation
Take a final look at the majestic empire I built and smile arrogantly

en.text: What will you do now?

choices.text: Lay down all burdens and rest within the souls of the creatures I made
Leave for a new journey to find places where truth and justice are needed
Conceive the next version of the cosmic OS based on collected data
Use this universe as an engine to build a larger multiverse system
Reign forever over this universe I finished and remain as King of Gods

en.text: Last question. Have you truly 'awakened'?

choices.text: I realized that love is the only truth in the universe
I realized the responsibility of existence and the weight of justice
I realized the universe is a vast flow of information and order
I realized everything is a process for evolution and growth
I realized that I am the beginning and master of all
